English (string): Hey I'm a red fish!  J
I'm also a red fish part 2 3.
$> Please take a moment to familiarize yourself with the Unwearnum class Deep Water Exploration Vessel. [Move: WASD]
$> You may initially find the quarters confined.
$> We assure you they meet human habitat standards as defined in Senate Statute 731.
$> Recall the primary mission directive:
$> Chart unexplored sector A2 of Anfloga, and recover any minerals you may discover.
$> Long range scans have indicated mineral richness in this sector. [Mine: Press Spacebar near a crystal]
$> Please harvest all mineral deposits in the sector. [Mine: Press spacebar near crystal]
$> The Unwearnum class vessel expends battery power to maintain human life support functions. [Meter on left of screen]
$> Remaining near the surface allows battery recharge via solar energy.
$> Authorization granted to enable high-output torch. [Torch: Right Click]
$> Be aware that torch use requires additional battery drain.
$> Do you enjoy the fresh air? An encouraging motivation to complete your contract.
$> These bubbles indicate the presence of a possible power source--please investigate.
$> Use 8 minerals to create a permanent power station on this geothermal vent. [Move to source of bubbles and press Spacebar]
(The onship instruments detect a feint signal from in this tunnel)
$> Warning, this tunnel is of considerable depth. Immediate turnabout is advised.
(The signal, though still weak, is growing in strength.)
$> Alert! Be assured your current battery does not have sufficient capacity to reach the tunnel's end. Change course now!
(Could it be a distress beacon?)
$> This is your final warning, turn back now!
$> Water covers 95 percent of Anfloga.
$> The clay and volcanic soil lacks stability required for large-scale construction.
$> No civilizations have existed on the planet.
$> However, Anfloga is home to over 28,000 species of fish!
(It looks like some sort of stonework?)
(There's no way the fish built this...)
(There appears to be some sort of animal remains nestled along the seafloor here.)
(Is that a human skull?)
Log 5: This will be my final log. The bastards shut the power off. Waiting for me to die then sending the bots to pick up the crystals.
(There's data log buried in the sand.) Log 1:  I made it all the way to sector A2. Over 1000 nautical miles. No one's been to this sector.
Log 3:  I discovered the ruins of some civilization today. Why would there be ruins this far underwater? How are they preserved so well?
Log 4: The power stations they have me building are a horrible design. Why are they radiating this much heat? So inefficient.
Log 2: Something must be wrong with my equipment. The scans say these ruins are only about 50 years old?
Computer, is it legal to purchase an inhabited planet?
$> Senate Statute 117: "No purchase of a planet harboring an active civilization shall be permitted."
$> All power stations deactivating. Please remain calm and avoid damaging the Unearnum class Deep Water Exploration Vessel.
(Making it to the surface is my only chance!)
